newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch PTT has higher first half net profit.
newsitem.headline: Dutch PTT has higher first half net profit.

text.p: The 45 percent government-owned Dutch PTT announced higher first half net profit on Friday and repeated a previous forecast of growth at the company for 1996.

Post and telecoms group Koninklijke PTT Nederland NV said net profit in the first half to June 30 rose 8.5 percent to 1.209 billion guilders ($724 million) from 1.114 billion in the first half of 1995.
The interim dividend rose to 1.00 guilders per share, up from the previous 0.90 guilders, while net sales rose to 9.94 billion guilders from 9.41 billion.
Dutch PTT said the postal and telecoms units had both had a good first half with volumes increasing in all sectors and sales growing despite significant price cuts in telecommunications.
"Smaller additions to reorganisation provisions than in the first half of 1995 had a positive effect on the growth of operating income," the company said in a statement. ($1=1.669 Guilder)
